basics.name: Jhanvi K.Garg
basics.summary: Ph.D. student at Texas A&M University

publications.name: Soft-constrained SchrÃ¶dinger Bridge: a Stochastic Control Approach
publications.publisher: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Statistics
publications.summary: The soft-constrained SchrÃ¶dinger bridge (SSB) is a generalization of the SchrÃ¶dinger bridge problem, where the terminal distribution is allowed to differ from the target distribution but is penalized by the Kullback-Leibler divergence. This approach is used to develop robust generative diffusion models and is demonstrated on the MNIST dataset.

publications.name: A quickest detection problem with false negatives
publications.summary: The problem involves detecting a drift in a Brownian motion with false negatives and costs for inspections. It is formulated as an optimal multiple stopping problem which is equivalent to a recursive optimal stopping problem. By using free boundary methods, explicit formulas for the expected cost and optimal strategy are derived.

publications.name: Rapid measurement and statistical ranking of leaf drought tolerance capacity in cotton
publications.summary: This study evaluates leaf dry matter content as an effective and faster alternative to leaf osmotic potential for measuring cotton drought tolerance. We develop a Bayesian model to rank drought tolerance, and finds a trade-off between drought tolerance and fiber yield/quality.

work.name: Daiichi Sankyo Inc
work.summary: Worked on Bayesian Dynamic Borrowing to demonstrate enhanced clinical effectiveness of a breast cancer drug.
highlights: Mentors: Dr. Prathiba Batley and Dr. Arthur Allingol

work.name: Los Alamos National laboratory
work.summary: Analyzing vibrational data with machine learning to detect and spatially locate damage in micro reactors.
highlights: Mentors: Dr. TJ Ulrich and Dr. Paul Geimer

work.name: Teaching Assistant
work.summary: Teaching assistant for Probability for Statistics, Mathematical Statistics I, Mathematical Statistics II, Introduction to Linear Model, Multivariate Analysis and Statistical Learning Theory, Statistical Methods in Finance.

work.name: Instructor
work.summary: Taught Elementary Statistical Inference course for Undergraduate students.

work.name: Sixth Energy Technologies
work.summary: Analyzed building management system data to assess operational efficiency and energy consumption patterns. Also analyzed fuel tank data for refills, thefts, and leaks, utilizing exponential smoothing and ARIMA models for predictions.

work.name: Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad
work.summary: Conducted a survey and analyzed the data regarding the adoption and usage of electric vehicles in India.

volunteer.organization: SIAM Journal on Control and Optimization

volunteer.summary: Led interactive sessions on data management and machine learning for high school students.
Organized math camp for high school students.
Mentored students in topics including maintaing effective communication. aligning expectations, assessing understanding, addressing equity and inclusion, fostering independence.

projects.name: Branch-and-Cut for Linear Programming
projects.summary: Research Experience for Undergraduates (REU) at Texas Tech University.
highlights: worked under the advisory of Dr. Ismael R. de-Farias.
focused on exploring the Branch-and-Cut method for linear programming with multiple-choice constraints
applied CPLEX and Gurobi to implement and evaluate the algorithms developed
